steps.description: Create package.json in the ProgressPath project root with Tailwind CSS v4, PostCSS, and Autoprefixer as dev dependencies. Include scripts: 'build:css' for production build ('npx @tailwindcss/cli -i ./wwwroot/css/app.src.css -o ./wwwroot/css/app.css --minify'), 'watch:css' for development ('npx @tailwindcss/cli -i ./wwwroot/css/app.src.css -o ./wwwroot/css/app.css --watch'). Set name to 'progresspath-styles', version '1.0.0', private: true.

Create the Tailwind source CSS file that will be compiled. This file uses Tailwind v4's CSS-first approach with @import 'tailwindcss' and @theme directive. Include: (1) @import 'tailwindcss' at top, (2) @theme block defining custom colors (--color-primary: #ff6b9d, --color-primary-50 through -900 shades, --color-secondary: #c084fc with shades, --color-tertiary: #22d3d8 with shades, --color-accent: #a78bfa, --color-highlight: #f0abfc, --color-dark-bg: #0f0a1a, --color-dark-surface: #1a0f2e), font families (--font-heading: 'Outfit', sans-serif; --font-body: 'Inter', sans-serif), custom shadows for glow effects (--shadow-glow-sm, --shadow-glow, --shadow-glow-lg, --shadow-glow-pink, --shadow-glow-purple), and animation definitions (--animate-glow-pulse, --animate-float). (3) @keyframes for glow-pulse (3s ease-in-out infinite, box-shadow transition from 20px to 30px spread with teal glow) and float (6s ease-in-out infinite, translateY from 0 to -10px). (4) Base styles for html (scroll-behavior: smooth, overflow-x: hidden) and body (font-family: var(--font-body), background-color: var(--color-dark-bg), color: white). (5) Heading styles (h1-h6 use font-family: var(--font-heading)). (6) Component classes: .glow-container (transparent bg, 1.5rem border-radius, 1px solid rgba(34,211,216,0.4) border, multi-layer box-shadow with teal glow, hover state with increased glow), .inner-card (1rem border-radius, 1.5rem padding, rgba(192,132,252,0.1) bg, 1px solid rgba(192,132,252,0.2) border, backdrop-filter blur(8px), hover states), .gradient-text (linear-gradient from primary to secondary to tertiary, background-clip: text, color: transparent), .gradient-text-pink (primary to secondary gradient), .glow-button (0.75rem 1.5rem padding, 1rem border-radius, font-heading, gradient bg from primary to secondary, white text, glow shadow, hover with scale(1.05) and enhanced glow), .animate-glow (animation: glow-pulse 3s ease-in-out infinite). Reference the TherapistTemplate index.css for exact values.

Update the existing app.css file to be the compiled output location. For initial development before first npm build, replace the existing content with the compiled Tailwind output structure: keep the CSS variables and base styles, add Tailwind's base/components/utilities layer outputs. This file will be overwritten by the Tailwind build process, but provide initial working styles including all the component classes (.glow-container, .inner-card, .gradient-text, .glow-button) and keyframe animations so the app works before npm install is run.

Update App.razor to add Google Fonts link for Outfit and Inter fonts in the head section. Add: <link rel='preconnect' href='https://fonts.googleapis.com'>, <link rel='preconnect' href='https://fonts.gstatic.com' crossorigin>, <link href='https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@400;500;600&family=Outfit:wght@400;500;600;700&display=swap' rel='stylesheet'>. Place these links before the app.css stylesheet link.

Create a postcss.config.js file in the ProgressPath root for PostCSS configuration (required by Tailwind v4). Export default configuration with plugins array containing '@tailwindcss/postcss' and 'autoprefixer'.

Update the .csproj file to add a Target that runs npm build before the main build. Add a Target named 'BuildTailwind' with BeforeTargets='Build' and Condition that checks if node_modules exists. The Target should execute npm run build:css. Also add an ItemGroup that excludes node_modules from the project. This ensures Tailwind CSS is compiled as part of the dotnet build process.

considerations: Tailwind v4 uses CSS-first configuration (@theme directive) instead of tailwind.config.js - follow the TherapistTemplate pattern exactly
The package.json should use @tailwindcss/cli for building since this is not a Vite/React project like TherapistTemplate
Initial app.css should contain working styles so the app functions before npm install is run (fallback)
The .csproj MSBuild integration should be conditional - only run npm build if node_modules exists to avoid build failures on fresh clones before npm install
Google Fonts preconnect links improve loading performance and should come before the font CSS link
The app.src.css is the source file that Tailwind compiles from; app.css is the output that Blazor references
For local development, developers need to run 'npm install' once and then either 'npm run watch:css' for hot reload or rely on dotnet build to compile CSS
Consider adding node_modules/ to .gitignore if not already present
The glow effects use rgba colors with specific opacity values - maintain exact values from TherapistTemplate for visual consistency
Font weights: Outfit needs 400,500,600,700 for headings; Inter needs 400,500,600 for body text
